"using" keyword has two main uses:
-> using directives	: allows using types from another namespace and create allies 
-> using statement	: defines the scope in which an IDisposable will be used and disposed at this scope's end


Question:
1. What are the global using directives?
-> when we use global directive, we don't need to put using on each .cs file


We notice that we don't have the using statement on the top of the Program.cs file. 
Where there are located(starting with C#10):
-> [project file] -> \obj\Debug\net9.0 -> [project name].GlobalUsing.g.cs :

// <auto-generated/>
global using global::System;
global using global::System.Collections.Generic;
global using global::System.IO;
global using global::System.Linq;
global using global::System.Net.Http;
global using global::System.Threading;
global using global::System.Threading.Tasks;
